name: fickleness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
disapproving the quality of being likely to change your opinion or your feelings suddenly and without a good reason: the fickleness of modern-day football fans the fickleness of public taste
the quality of being likely to change suddenly and without warning: the fickleness of fortune The incident demonstrated the fickleness of politics. See
fickle
More examplesFewer examplesHe had a reputation for fickleness and broken promises.the fickleness of success in the movie businessThe athletes were aware of the fickleness of the crowd.the fickleness of the art marketWe are at the mercy of the weather's fickleness.
